description: The Latest on the siege of a Philippine city that led President Rodrigo Duterte to declare martial law in the south (all times local):
title: The Latest: Duterte considering nationwide martial law

author: Nyshka Chandran
description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's hint of nationwide martial law has triggered fears of further human rights violations.
title: Philippines: Duterte's talk of martial law sparks fresh human rights worries

author: Marc Jayson Cayabyab
description: Representatives from the militant Makabayan bloc in Congress on Wednesday opposed President Rodrigo Duterte's declaration of martial law in Mindanao, vowing to vote to revoke the proclamation once the President reports to Congress.
title: Militant solons oppose Duterte’s martial law declaration

author: Euan McKirdy, Joshua Berlinger, CNN
description: Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte said his martial law declaration for the country's restive south could be expanded "throughout the country" in order to combat the rise of ISIS.
title: Duterte says he may expand martial law 'throughout the country' in fight against ISIS

author: Al Jazeera
description: Ongoing violence prompts 'mass exodus' from Marawi, as President Rodrigo Duterte considers nationwide martial law.
title: Mindanao: Churchgoers 'taken hostage' amid Marawi siege

author: Al Jazeera
description: Under martial law, Philippine security forces bomb ISIL-linked fighters hiding in besieged southern city.
title: Mindanao: Air raids target fighters holed up in Marawi

author: Colin Dwyer
description: With an island under martial law and civilians escaping Marawi City, which is occupied by ISIS-linked militants, President Rodrigo Duterte struck a hard line Wednesday: "If you fight us you will die."
title: After Botched Raid, Philippines Tries To Reclaim A City Under Siege

description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte warned Wednesday that he’ll be harsh in enforcing martial law in his country’s south as he abruptly left Moscow to deal with a crisis at home sparked by a Muslim extremist siege on a city, where militants burned buildings overnight and are feared to have taken hostages.
title: Duterte declares martial rule in besieged south Philippines

author: JIM GOMEZ and TERESA CEROJANO
description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte warned Wednesday that he'll be harsh in enforcing martial law in his country's south as he abruptly left Moscow to deal with a crisis at home sparked by a Muslim extremist siege on a city, where militants burned buildings overnight and are feared to have taken hostages. Duterte declared martial rule for 60 days in the entire southern Mindanao region, the restive third of the Philippine archipelago, Tuesday evening to try to crush Muslim extremists who have aligned themselves with the Islamic State group and occupied a hospital, jail and other buildings and battled troops in an audacious attack in Marawi City.
title: Duterte declares martial rule in besieged south Philippines
